body_html:
Happens to me too, very frustrating. I have the same configuration and it fails with python 3.5/3.6, pip install with cuda 8. I noticed that in a script (not a jupyter notebook) if you import matplotlib pyplot before the pytorch package it fails:

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import torch

but if you invert the imports it works:

import torch
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

In jupyter it fails in both cases.
Hope it helps... somehow.

but if you invert the imports it works:

In jupyter it fails in both cases.
Hope it helps... somehow.
body:
Happens to me too, very frustrating. I have the same configuration and it fails with python 3.5/3.6, pip install with cuda 8. I noticed that in a script (not a jupyter notebook) if you import matplotlib pyplot before the pytorch package it fails:
```
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import torch
```
but if you invert the imports it works:
```
import torch
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
```
In jupyter it fails in both cases.
Hope it helps... somehow.
